#!/bin/bash

# è®¿é—®ç»Ÿè®¡æ—¥å¿—å¤„ç†è„šæœ¬ - mainç”¨æˆ·ç‰ˆæœ¬
LOG_DIR="/home/main/logs"
NGINX_LOG="/var/log/nginx/access.log"
TIMESTAMP=$(date +"%Y%m%d_%H%M")
OUTPUT_FILE="$LOG_DIR/stats_$TIMESTAMP.json"

# ç¡®ä¿æ—¥å¿—ç›®å½•å­˜åœ¨
mkdir -p "$LOG_DIR"

# ç”Ÿæˆè¿‡å»24å°æ—¶æ•°æ®
echo "ç”Ÿæˆ24å°æ—¶è®¿é—®ç»Ÿè®¡..." > "$LOG_DIR/process.log"

# æå–ä¸»é¡µè®¿é—®è®°å½•å¹¶ç»Ÿè®¡æ¯å°æ—¶è®¿é—®é‡
cat "$NGINX_LOG" /var/log/nginx/access.log.1 2>/dev/null | \
grep -E "GET / HTTP" | \
awk '{print $4}' | \
sed 's/\[//g' | \
cut -d: -f2 | \
sort -n | \
uniq -c > /tmp/hourly_raw.txt

# ç”ŸæˆJSONæ ¼å¼æ•°æ®
echo '{"hourly_data":[' > "$OUTPUT_FILE"

total=0
peak_count=0
peak_hour=0

for hour in {0..23}; do
    count=$(grep -E "^\s*[0-9]+\s+$(printf "%02d" $hour)$" /tmp/hourly_raw.txt | awk '{print $1}')
    [[ -z "$count" ]] && count=0
    
    total=$((total + count))
    
    if [[ $count -gt $peak_count ]]; then
        peak_count=$count
        peak_hour=$hour
    fi
    
    if [[ $hour -eq 23 ]]; then
        echo "{\"hour\":$hour,\"count\":$count}" >> "$OUTPUT_FILE"
    else
        echo "{\"hour\":$hour,\"count\":$count}," >> "$OUTPUT_FILE"
    fi
done

avg=$((total / 24))

cat >> "$OUTPUT_FILE" << EOF
],
"summary":{
"total_visits":$total,
"peak_hour":"$(printf "%02d:00" $peak_hour)",
"avg_hourly":$avg,
"last_update":"$(date '+%Y-%m-%d %H:%M')"
},
"timestamp":"$TIMESTAMP"
}
EOF

# æ¸…ç†æ—§æ—¥å¿—æ–‡ä»¶(ä¿ç•™æœ€è¿‘10ä¸ª)
ls -t "$LOG_DIR"/stats_*.json 2>/dev/null | tail -n +11 | xargs rm -f 2>/dev/null || true

# æ¸…ç†ä¸´æ—¶æ–‡ä»¶
rm -f /tmp/hourly_raw.txt

# åŒæ­¥åˆ°wwwå­˜å‚¨æ¡¶çš„logç›®å½•
cp "$OUTPUT_FILE" "/mnt/www/log/" 2>/dev/null || true

echo "$(date): Stats generated - $OUTPUT_FILE, Total: $total visits" >> "$LOG_DIR/process.log"

#!/bin/bash

# è®¿é—®ç»Ÿè®¡æ—¥å¿—å¤„ç†è„šæœ¬ - mainç”¨æˆ·ç‰ˆæœ¬
LOG_DIR="/home/main/logs"
NGINX_LOG="/var/log/nginx/access.log"
TIMESTAMP=$(date +"%Y%m%d_%H%M")
OUTPUT_FILE="$LOG_DIR/stats_$TIMESTAMP.json"

# ç¡®ä¿æ—¥å¿—ç›®å½•å­˜åœ¨
mkdir -p "$LOG_DIR"

# ç”Ÿæˆè¿‡å»24å°æ—¶æ•°æ®
echo "ç”Ÿæˆ24å°æ—¶è®¿é—®ç»Ÿè®¡..." > "$LOG_DIR/process.log"

# è·å–å½“å‰æ—¶é—´å’Œ24å°æ—¶å‰çš„æ—¶é—´
current_epoch=$(date +%s)
yesterday_epoch=$((current_epoch - 86400))

# æå–è¿‡å»24å°æ—¶çš„è®¿é—®è®°å½•å¹¶æŒ‰å°æ—¶ç»Ÿè®¡
{
    cat "$NGINX_LOG" 2>/dev/null
    cat /var/log/nginx/access.log.1 2>/dev/null
    cat /var/log/nginx/access.log.*.gz 2>/dev/null | zcat 2>/dev/null
} | grep -E "GET / HTTP" | \
awk -v yesterday="$yesterday_epoch" '
{
    # è§£ææ—¶é—´æˆ³ [dd/Mon/yyyy:hh:mm:ss +timezone]
    gsub(/\[/, "", $4)
    cmd = "date -d \"" $4 "\" +%s"
    cmd | getline timestamp
    close(cmd)
    
    if (timestamp >= yesterday) {
        cmd2 = "date -d \"" $4 "\" +%H"
        cmd2 | getline hour
        close(cmd2)
        hours[hour]++
    }
}
END {
    for (i = 0; i < 24; i++) {
        printf "%d %02d\n", (hours[sprintf("%02d", i)] ? hours[sprintf("%02d", i)] : 0), i
    }
}' | sort -k2 -n > /tmp/hourly_raw.txt

# ç”ŸæˆJSONæ ¼å¼æ•°æ®
echo '{"hourly_data":[' > "$OUTPUT_FILE"

total=0
peak_count=0
peak_hour=0

for hour in {0..23}; do
    count=$(grep -E "^\s*[0-9]+\s+$(printf "%02d" $hour)$" /tmp/hourly_raw.txt | awk '{print $1}')
    [[ -z "$count" ]] && count=0
    
    total=$((total + count))
    
    if [[ $count -gt $peak_count ]]; then
        peak_count=$count
        peak_hour=$hour
    fi
    
    if [[ $hour -eq 23 ]]; then
        echo "{\"hour\":$hour,\"count\":$count}" >> "$OUTPUT_FILE"
    else
        echo "{\"hour\":$hour,\"count\":$count}," >> "$OUTPUT_FILE"
    fi
done

avg=$((total / 24))

cat >> "$OUTPUT_FILE" << EOF
],
"summary":{
"total_visits":$total,
"peak_hour":"$(printf "%02d:00" $peak_hour)",
"avg_hourly":$avg,
"last_update":"$(date '+%Y-%m-%d %H:%M')"
},
"timestamp":"$TIMESTAMP"
}
EOF

# æ¸…ç†æ—§æ—¥å¿—æ–‡ä»¶(ä¿ç•™æœ€è¿‘10ä¸ª)
ls -t "$LOG_DIR"/stats_*.json 2>/dev/null | tail -n +11 | xargs rm -f 2>/dev/null || true

# æ¸…ç†ä¸´æ—¶æ–‡ä»¶
rm -f /tmp/hourly_raw.txt

# åŒæ­¥åˆ°wwwå­˜å‚¨æ¡¶çš„logç›®å½•

current_epoch=$(date +%s)
yesterday_epoch=$((current_epoch - 86400))

# æå–è¿‡å»24å°æ—¶çš„è®¿é—®è®°å½•å¹¶æŒ‰å°æ—¶ç»Ÿè®¡
{
    cat "$NGINX_LOG" 2>/dev/null
    cat /var/log/nginx/access.log.1 2>/dev/null
    cat /var/log/nginx/access.log.*.gz 2>/dev/null | zcat 2>/dev/null
} | grep -E "GET / HTTP" | \
awk -v yesterday="$yesterday_epoch" '
{
    # è§£ææ—¶é—´æˆ³ [dd/Mon/yyyy:hh:mm:ss +timezone]
    gsub(/\[/, "", $4)
    cmd = "date -d \"" $4 "\" +%s"
    cmd | getline timestamp
    close(cmd)
    
    if (timestamp >= yesterday) {
        cmd2 = "date -d \"" $4 "\" +%H"
        cmd2 | getline hour
        close(cmd2)
        hours[hour]++
    }
}
END {
    for (i = 0; i < 24; i++) {
        printf "%d %02d\n", (hours[sprintf("%02d", i)] ? hours[sprintf("%02d", i)] : 0), i
    }
}' | sort -k2 -n > /tmp/hourly_raw.txt

# ç”ŸæˆJSONæ ¼å¼æ•°æ®
echo '{"hourly_data":[' > "$OUTPUT_FILE"

total=0
peak_count=0
peak_hour=0

for hour in {0..23}; do
    count=$(awk -v h="$(printf "%02d" $hour)" '$2 == h {print $1}' /tmp/hourly_raw.txt)
    [[ -z "$count" ]] && count=0
    
    total=$((total + count))
    
    if [[ $count -gt $peak_count ]]; then
        peak_count=$count
        peak_hour=$hour
    fi
    
    if [[ $hour -eq 23 ]]; then
        echo "{\"hour\":$hour,\"count\":$count}" >> "$OUTPUT_FILE"
    else
        echo "{\"hour\":$hour,\"count\":$count}," >> "$OUTPUT_FILE"
    fi
done

avg=$((total / 24))

cat >> "$OUTPUT_FILE" << EOF
],
"summary":{
"total_visits":$total,
"peak_hour":"$(printf "%02d:00" $peak_hour)",
"avg_hourly":$avg,
"last_update":"$(date '+%Y-%m-%d %H:%M')"
},
"timestamp":"$TIMESTAMP"
}
EOF

# æ¸…ç†æ—§æ—¥å¿—æ–‡ä»¶(ä¿ç•™æœ€è¿‘10ä¸ª)
ls -t "$LOG_DIR"/stats_*.json 2>/dev/null | tail -n +11 | xargs rm -f 2>/dev/null || true

# æ¸…ç†ä¸´æ—¶æ–‡ä»¶
rm -f /tmp/hourly_raw.txt

# åŒæ­¥åˆ°wwwå­˜å‚¨æ¡¶çš„logç›®å½•
cp "$OUTPUT_FILE" "/mnt/www/log/" 2>/dev/null || true

echo "$(date): Stats generated - $OUTPUT_FILE, Total: $total visits" >> "$LOG_DIR/process.log"

#!/bin/bash

# è®¿é—®ç»Ÿè®¡æ—¥å¿—å¤„ç†è„šæœ¬ - mainç”¨æˆ·ç‰ˆæœ¬
LOG_DIR="/home/main/logs"
NGINX_LOG="/var/log/nginx/access.log"
TIMESTAMP=$(date +"%Y%m%d_%H%M")
OUTPUT_FILE="$LOG_DIR/stats_$TIMESTAMP.json"

# ç¡®ä¿æ—¥å¿—ç›®å½•å­˜åœ¨
mkdir -p "$LOG_DIR"

# ç”Ÿæˆè¿‡å»24å°æ—¶æ•°æ®
echo "ç”Ÿæˆ24å°æ—¶è®¿é—®ç»Ÿè®¡..." > "$LOG_DIR/process.log"

# è·å–å½“å‰æ—¶é—´å’Œ24å°æ—¶å‰çš„æ—¶é—´
current_epoch=$(date +%s)
yesterday_epoch=$((current_epoch - 86400))

# æå–è¿‡å»24å°æ—¶çš„è®¿é—®è®°å½•å¹¶æŒ‰å°æ—¶ç»Ÿè®¡
{
    cat "$NGINX_LOG" 2>/dev/null
    cat /var/log/nginx/access.log.1 2>/dev/null
    cat /var/log/nginx/access.log.*.gz 2>/dev/null | zcat 2>/dev/null
} | grep -E "GET / HTTP" | \
awk -v yesterday="$yesterday_epoch" '
{
    # è§£ææ—¶é—´æˆ³ [dd/Mon/yyyy:hh:mm:ss +timezone]
    gsub(/\[/, "", $4)
    cmd = "date -d \"" $4 "\" +%s"
    cmd | getline timestamp
    close(cmd)
    
    if (timestamp >= yesterday) {
        cmd2 = "date -d \"" $4 "\" +%H"
        cmd2 | getline hour
        close(cmd2)
        hours[hour]++
    }
}
END {
    for (i = 0; i < 24; i++) {
        printf "%d %02d\n", (hours[sprintf("%02d", i)] ? hours[sprintf("%02d", i)] : 0), i
    }
}' | sort -k2 -n > /tmp/hourly_raw.txt

# ç”ŸæˆJSONæ ¼å¼æ•°æ®
echo '{"hourly_data":[' > "$OUTPUT_FILE"

total=0
peak_count=0
peak_hour=0

for hour in {0..23}; do
    count=$(awk -v h="$(printf "%02d" $hour)" '$2 == h {print $1}' /tmp/hourly_raw.txt)
    [[ -z "$count" ]] && count=0
    
    total=$((total + count))
    
    if [[ $count -gt $peak_count ]]; then
        peak_count=$count
        peak_hour=$hour
    fi
    
    if [[ $hour -eq 23 ]]; then
        echo "{\"hour\":$hour,\"count\":$count}" >> "$OUTPUT_FILE"
    else
        echo "{\"hour\":$hour,\"count\":$count}," >> "$OUTPUT_FILE"
    fi
done

avg=$((total / 24))

cat >> "$OUTPUT_FILE" << EOF
],
"summary":{
"total_visits":$total,
"peak_hour":"$(printf "%02d:00" $peak_hour)",
"peak_count":$peak_count,
"avg_hourly":$avg,
"current_hour":"$(date '+%H')",
"current_hour_visits":$(awk -v h="$(date '+%H')" '$2 == h {print $1}' /tmp/hourly_raw.txt | head -1),
"last_update":"$(date '+%Y-%m-%d %H:%M')",
"period":"è¿‡å»24å°æ—¶"
},
"timestamp":"$TIMESTAMP"
}
EOF

# æ¸…ç†æ—§æ—¥å¿—æ–‡ä»¶(ä¿ç•™æœ€è¿‘10ä¸ª)
ls -t "$LOG_DIR"/stats_*.json 2>/dev/null | tail -n +11 | xargs rm -f 2>/dev/null || true

# æ¸…ç†ä¸´æ—¶æ–‡ä»¶
rm -f /tmp/hourly_raw.txt

# åŒæ­¥åˆ°wwwå­˜å‚¨æ¡¶çš„logç›®å½•
cp "$OUTPUT_FILE" "/mnt/www/log/" 2>/dev/null || true

echo "$(date): Stats generated - $OUTPUT_FILE, Total: $total visits" >> "$LOG_DIR/process.log"
